client_profile: Couple relocating to Brussels, looking to buy an apartment priced 790,000–1,260,000 EUR. Priorities include restaurants, cafes, quiet residential areas, and value for money.
contradictions: Quiet neighborhoods may limit dining options
Higher safety areas often come with higher prices
Value for money might mean sacrificing space
Remote work may reduce priority on commute

top_districts.name: Ixelles
why: Châtelain is vibrant, filled with cafes and restaurants catering to diverse tastes.
Flagey hosts vibrant markets and lovely green spaces perfect for relaxation.
watch_out: Popular streets can become noisy during weekends, complicating parking.

top_districts.name: Etterbeek
why: Jourdan district offers a mix of cafes and restaurants, ideal for modern living.
Cinquantenaire park enhances community life with recreational spaces for families.
watch_out: Rents near EU quarter tend to be higher; watch for budget impact.

top_districts.name: Saint-Gilles
why: Parvis de Saint-Gilles is known for its bustling cafes and artistic vibe.
Barriere area maintains proximity to vibrant nightlife while offering residential peace.
watch_out: Some streets can be lively and noisy late into the night.
